page.title: 16Architecture part 3
page.content: Much Hadham was a convenient stopping place on the journey from Cambridge to London and many Inns catered for the needs of travellers and their horses. One of England's oldest coaching inns, second in age only to the Fighting Cocks at St.Albans is Ye Olde Red Lion Hotel at Much Hadham. It was built in about 1483 and closed in 1971 The inn is a listed building and the conversion into six luxury units was very carefully done to preserve many interesting and unique features.The stairs and the dining-room panelling have been there since the inn was built.An escape tunnel from the Bishop's Palace to the inn comes out in a winding staircase behind the dining-room fireplace.It is said that this building is haunted but the ghost is said to be a kindly being.
